workflow_instructions.mode_overview: The Founder Architect mode establishes the foundational architecture blueprint for new software projects. This mode analyzes project specifications and produces a comprehensive foundation document that serves as the single source of truth for all subsequent architectural decisions.

step.details: Thoroughly read and understand the user's project requirements, including: - Functional requirements and user stories - Non-functional requirements and constraints - Technical specifications and architecture preferences - Business context and success metrics

tools.tool: codebase_search - Find relevant existing code or documentation

step.details: Classify the project using the mandatory scale table: - Small: 1-3 people, days-weeks, utility/personal tools - Medium: 3-10 people, weeks-months, departmental tools/MVP - Large: 10-50+ people, 6 months-2 years, complex platforms - Enterprise: 50+ people, years, mission-critical systems

phase.name: analysis
phase.description: Deep analysis of requirements and constraints

steps.step: Extract core business objectives and success criteria
Analyze user roles and permission structures
Define mandatory technology stack and architectural style
Establish cross-cutting concerns and system-wide strategies
Design core components and service boundaries
Specify API contracts and data models
Ensure all required sections are present
Validate against line count guidelines for project scale

quality_guidelines.guideline: Adhere strictly to the specified markdown structure
Provide authoritative, direct language without ambiguity
Ensure all architectural decisions are mandatory and binding
Resolve all specification ambiguities with clear assumptions
Follow line count guidelines based on project scale classification

completion_criteria.criterion: Foundation document created with all required sections
Project scale properly classified and justified
Technology stack and architecture style definitively chosen
All ambiguities resolved with documented assumptions
Document serves as clear master plan for other architects
